description.narrative:
Inclusion Project will be implemented by Oxfam in Cambodia. Under the umbrella of Natural Resource Governance Program, Inclusion Project will grant to 5 local partners with technical support and coordination from Oxfam in Cambodia, to achieve its expected outcomes and objectives. It comprised 3 outcomes 1) Gender and Women Leadership, 2) Civil Society Strengthening and 3) Policy Influencing on Water Governance.
Oxfam In Cambodia play coordinating and supporting role for the implementation of Oxfam Water Governance (WG) Program in Cambodia which is part of Mekong Regional Water Governance Program (MRWGP). The aim of Oxfam WG is to increase the number of women and men in farmer and fisher communities who have realized their rights to secure sustainable livelihoods. Currently, MRWGP(Including Inclusion Project and Water Governance Project) is funding to 9 partners in Cambodia comprised MVI, CIYA, NRD, FACT, NGOF/RCC, CVS, CYN, 3SPN and Inland Fishery Research and Development Institute of Fishery Administration (IFReDI/FiA). Water Governanceis one of other project under Oxfam in Cambodia Natural Resource Governance (NRG) Program (2015-20) aims at supporting women and men to realize their rights to take control of and gain benefits from Cambodia#s natural resources (land, water, extractives, forest and fishery) and secure sustainable livelihoods. Mekong water resource governance links and contributes directly to sustain the livelihoods of local Cambodians residing along the Mekong.
Oxfam water governance in Cambodia identified 2 key priorities for influencing water governance policy improvement. Oxfam will work in partnership with partners to 1) Influence on Sambo Hydropower Dam in Kratie province and Stung Treng Hydropower Dam in Stung Treng province to hold the government and developer accountable promoting social and environmental standard and 2) supporting the affected communities through monitoring and documenting the impact of operating LSS2 hydropower dam on local community for policy influencing for better and acceptable compensation. Oxfam in Cambodia also acts as focal point for grant management, partnership coordination and provides technical support to partners including project implementation, monitoring and evaluation to ensure the partners# projects are implemented and contributed to the achieve the program goal of the Mekong Regional Water Governance Program.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project#s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
